nodes.documentation:
@title SimplePaymentChannel
@author Luis Videla
 * @dev Ethereum payment channels allow for off-chain transactions with an on-chain
settlement. In this implementation, a party (sender) can open a channel with a 
deposit, expiration, and recipient. The sender can then sign transactions off-chain
and send them to the recipient, who can submit one of these signed transactions to 
chain to close and settle the channel.
nodes.name: SimplePaymentChannel
closeChannel

nodes.documentation:
@dev Extend the expiration date of the channel
@param _expiration uint256 Updated expiration date
nodes.name: extendExpiration

nodes.documentation: @dev Allows sender to claim channel balance if expired
nodes.name: claimTimeout
isValidSignature

nodes.documentation:
@dev Builds a prefixed hash to mimic the behavior of eth_sign
@param _hash bytes32 Message hash to be prefixed
nodes.name: prefixed

devdoc.author: Luis Videla
devdoc.details: Ethereum payment channels allow for off-chain transactions with an on-chain settlement. In this implementation, a party (sender) can open a channel with a  deposit, expiration, and recipient. The sender can then sign transactions off-chain and send them to the recipient, who can submit one of these signed transactions to  chain to close and settle the channel.

claimTimeout().details: Allows sender to claim channel balance if expired

closeChannel(uint256,bytes).details: Close a channel with a signed message from the sender

params._balance: uint256 The balance agreed to by the sender in their signed message
params._signedMessage: bytes The signed hash of the balance by the sender

params._duration: uint256 Time period past creation that defines expiration
params._recipient: address Address of the receiving party

extendExpiration(uint256).details: Extend the expiration date of the channel

devdoc.title: SimplePaymentChannel
